name: Kepler-371
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-371 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-371 is a star with 0.9319999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.99 times its radius. It is located 2715.38 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-371 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-371 b

Kepler-371 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 34.76 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-371.

The mass of Kepler-371 b is 4.46 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-371 b is 1.89 that of Earth. At 4.46 Earth masses, Kepler-371 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-371 c

Kepler-371 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.31 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 67.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-371.

The mass of Kepler-371 c is 3.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-371 c is 1.78 that of Earth. At 3.85 Earth masses, Kepler-371 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-371, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
